taskman.view

Interface IUpdateTaskForm

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UpdateTaskForm

    public interface IUpdateTaskForm

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Developer getDeveloper(java.util.List<Developer> developers)
      This method will ask the user to select the developer to update a task and it will return the developer.
      Project getProjectWithAvailableTasks(java.util.List<Project> projects, java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> availableTasks)
      This method will ask the user to select a project and returns it.
      boolean getUpdateTaskFailed()
      This method will ask the user to enter whether or not the selected task has failed.
      org.joda.time.DateTime getUpdateTaskStopTime(org.joda.time.DateTime startTime)
      This method will view the start time of the selected task and ask the user to enter the end time of the selected task.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeveloper

        Developer getDeveloper(java.util.List<Developer> developers)
                       throws ShouldExitException
        This method will ask the user to select the developer to update a task and it will return the developer.
        Parameters:
        developers -
        Returns:
        Returns the selected developer.
        Throws:
        ShouldExitException - The user cancelled the updating of the task.

      • getUpdateTaskFailed

        boolean getUpdateTaskFailed()
        This method will ask the user to enter whether or not the selected task has failed.

      • getUpdateTaskStopTime

        org.joda.time.DateTime getUpdateTaskStopTime(org.joda.time.DateTime startTime)
        This method will view the start time of the selected task and ask the user to enter the end time of the selected task. Afterwards it will return the end time as a DateTime.
        Parameters:
        startTime -
        Returns:
        Returns the end time as a DateTime.
        Throws:
        ShouldExitException

      • getProjectWithAvailableTasks

        Project getProjectWithAvailableTasks(java.util.List<Project> projects,
                                   java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> availableTasks)
        This method will ask the user to select a project and returns it.
        Parameters:
        projects -
        availableTasks -
        Throws:
        ShouldExitException
